info.text: Oh Krong it's a dragon run for your ... wait, not this time. Phew. Carry on.
Its mouth is enough to put you off cappaccinos for a week.
D'aww, it's so cute. You'd feel just horrible if something were to happen to it.
You'd think killing all these dogs would make YOU better at it, but apparently not.
Yeeks: because even diggles need something to feel sorry for.
It has no idea what it's doing.
Careful, the bottle it grew in was large enough to absorb at least a finger or two.
Terrible at everything it attempts, but it attempts an awful lot.
This putrid, malnurished dead-goblinoid-walking eyes the dungeon exit while desperately clutching an unidentified wand. What could possibly go wrong.
All those years of training for this? Are you a hero or Dredmor's gardener?
It's harder to accidentally step on now, you'll give it that.
You better hide your cabbage, hide your wine.
You better hide your cabbage, hide your wine.
It swings its eyestalks like canes and its shell is blinged out with diamond, yo.
This wooden, junk-limbed pile of debris blends in perfectly with other dungeons, it swears.
A teenage mimic in constant flux and unsure of its future.
Mimics, mimics everywhere.
It's a lie, but it's so beautiful and shiny that you can't look away.
WARNING: Choking hazard. Not suitable for heroes under the level of 3.
Tall enough to decobweb the ceiling with its gratuitous headpiece, but just wide enough to hide behind barrels.
Q: How do you fit a skyscraping tank into the same space as a diggle without collapsing the dungeon? A: Usually, you don't.
This mind-bogglingly oversized mecha is itself piloting an even larger mecha outside of the dungeon.
Known by reckless heroes everywhere as the more dangerous half of the cyclops.
If this were a floating eyebrow, it would be pointed diabolically downwards.
Ceiling Eye is watching you masquerade and it knows your every weakness.
Everyone dies.
What glorious power! What wonderous form! What ... is that tail coming from?
Its aura is majestic and zorkmid-ridden enough to inspire even the lowliest diggle.
A creature altogether too beautiful, and possibly suicidal, for this world.
A unicorn crossed with a dolphin crossed with a dragon crossed with a unicorn again, for extra purity.
It's not subtle, this one, is it.
This stalker wants to be you. Forever.
The fastest way to a hero's heart is through a surprise bloody chest wound.
It may be creepy and odious, but at least it knows when it's not wanted.
A fellow hero, for lack of a better word. He's wielding an imaginary dagger and two exp-boosting rings.
A fellow hero. It's polite to keep your distance. He's wearing knight boots and a bloodied amulet.
A fellow hero and former drinking buddy. He was a good guy before he became a diggle-sympathiser.
A fellow hero from a rival school. Crush her! She's carrying a cutely-decorated wand and a fractured demonic universal keystone.
Qzlyuoptices are real monsters with real names that just so happen to start with Q.
Its, uh, mucus coating has been destabilised by bacteria found- it's the acid version okay shut up.
Each pointed beak sizzles with absorbed lightning. Don't lick them.
Vile tentacles twist from nowhere. You've seen enough anime to know where this is going.
If a tree falls in a forest, it could kill somebody - unless you get in first.
You know, the kind hills grow from.
Something something self-contained universes. It tastes great in soup.
It's in the walls, the floor, the air, and it whispers a strangely familiar string of numbers.
Basically, run.
What kind of a lame element is heart, anyway.
Perhaps the second best reason not to build power plants near wizarding pubs.
Just like you, this vortex is unique and special and surprisingly vulnerable to fire.
Huh. Good thing these magical vortexes aren't closed systems.
The spirit of a murdered hero, twisted by suffering into a raging ghost. WITTY HUMOUR HERE.
Once a brave soldier, now a helpless puppet of a hateful lich. JK JK LOLOLOL.
Even life itself had to be worth gambling for the Kingdom. They all lost. DIGGLES SURE ARE SILLY.
Before the dungeon can be truly freed, you both must rise. THAT'S WHAT SHE SAID.
What this shy bird lacks in flight, it makes up for in beak.
My, what lovely teeth it has.
They're tired of your low-level bolt-fodder nonsense, so this time they've brought rocket launchers.
You like your storms like you like your coffee: a brewin'.
Look, she's friendly! Can you keep her?
A dank, blubberous creature carrying jangling keys and smelling faintly of porridge. Gr- grandpa?
You don't know what a Dar is. But you do know what a blade is.
'Stop staring at my chest!' 'NO.'
A depressingly mundane 'monster' unbothered by your silly heroic fantasies.
You're fighting this monster strictly for medicinal purposes.
Ugh, why is it always your turn to clean this up.

Betwixt these earthen embankments burgeons a bevy of sallow spores, nebulous nightmares ascending acres as mindless monstrosities DIE by hero's hand to feed for fear fleshes its fledgling form. Flee! Or fight. For it is only scum.
Hero College Rule #26: Don't walk into any lights. Unless fully equipped and bursting with mana, natch.
What happens when good spores go bad.
This golem is formed from highly unpleasant poisons.
D'aww, it's so cute. You'd feel just horrible if something were to happen to it.
Its aura is majestic and zorkmid-ridden enough to inspire even the lowliest diggle.
Tall enough to decobweb the ceiling with its gratuitous headpiece, but just wide enough to hide behind barrels.
Sometimes, haters have good reasons to hate.
The what.
Elves are better at everything, including tipping strippers and improvising ammunition supplies.
